number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												There's no reason for debate over whether or not this is a game, so let's get that out of the way, first. A game is a form of play or sport, usually competitive, involving rules that is decided by skill, strength, or luck. Mountain involves none of these things. This should not detract from what it is and not everything developed with tools often used to make games needs to be a game.That aside, here is what you can expect from Mountain:When you launch it, you are asked to draw a few things on the screen with your mouse, to generate a random seed with which your mountain will be generated. After that, you will watch your mountain (a hunk of earth floating in outer space) spin slowly around. Sometimes the weather will change and foliage will change. Sometimes, an item will land on the mountain, like a ball, lollipop, jet engine, ladies shoes, or umbrella. Every so often, the mountain will say something to you, like "I feel at one with the universe, tonight".After a bunch of hours, something happens. I don't know what it is, because I fell asleep. When it hit about the 20th hour, it started making a ton of noise and went to a "game over" screen.Essentially, Mountain is what used to be considered a demo. A little program that someone would have distributed on a floppy disk for free -- or maybe sold for fifty cents at the local nicotine-filled hacker-computer-shop that we haven't seen much of since the mid 90s. It doesn't really do anything; you don't either. You just look at it until it stops. You can make the screen small and stick it in the corner of your screen, if you like.So, would I recommend it? I wouldn't say it is garbage, by any means. If it seems like something you might be interested in and you buy it with the understanding that there's no game involved and you wont' be doing anything, then it is hard to complain about it costing a dollar -- which is absolutely the right price for this tiny curiosity. Therefore, with those reservations, I'd give this a recommendation.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												A mix of thriller and an mmorpg (potential wow-killer), Mountain covers the life of Mountain, from birth to ultimate annihilation. You take care of Mountain by cleaning it, taking out the trash, and help its singing career, which could save it from the apocolypse. In its lows, fish and fire will rain from the sky but if you are good enough, you can make it rain cold hard cash (coins). If you are the type of player who likes to see things burn, lead Mountain to its demise. I would only recommend this game to those willing to put a lot of time and effort into grooming your Mountain into success. Those who only play this shortly without allowing this game's amazing depth and quality influence your life indeed are very poor souls. In my personal experience, it takes several hundred hours with this game to fully experience it.I have only completed Mountain a couple of times in the time I've played, and I hope to get a lot more in the future. I can easily recommend this to anyone willing to sell their souls to the Mountain. 10/10 would sacrifice myself to the mountain again.

Posted: December 8, 2014
												At a dollar, I'm not sure if I'd say that this is a /waste/ of money, but it's certainly not the best use of 99 cents I could name. If you want a quiet, resource-intensive screensaver, a cheap, slightly awkard piano program, or you just like seeing random objects intermitently strike a small, 3D peak, this thing might be for you.If you're looking to get some fun out of the thing, look up the guides on what tunes create what effects. That much, at least, kept my interest for about a dollar's-worth of time.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												This game makes you say phrases which you would have never thought could be said in any context ever. "Oh no, there's a pickaxe in my Icecream-cone!" "My mountain seems to use his teeth to play the violin", "Seems like there's a fan stuck between my brains", "Oh my god, a HUUUUGE telephone crushed my meteor-forest" or "Hit me gramophone! Hit me, please - Nooo! Come back, gramophone, come baaack!".Also, after you spent some time with your mountain, you really feel connected to it. I named mine Bjørg (which is somewhat similar to the german "Berg", which means "mountain") and I already created a [OMGIJUSTGOTHITBYAGIANTLIGHTBULBTHISISTHEBESTDAYOFMYLIFE] folder to document my best moments with Bjørg. So far there is "Bjørgplayinginthesnow.png" and "Bjørdsmilinglikeanangel.png" in there.The only thing I'm sorta missing would be a Multimountainmode, where you can come over to a friends mountain and let your mountain talk to your friends mountain for a while. You know, them kids have to learn from others of their kind. Maybe they'll fall in love, crush into each other and become a mothermountain with two tops which are eventually going to draw smaller mountains into their orbit which have some similar genes and what not. You know, the full potential of this just hasn't been reached yet.I highly recommend playing this game with some friends, you're gonna fun the hell out of it (for reals, a bunch of people in a skype-call, all playing this game for several hours is something that happened last night).

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												This is probably the realest, most advanced, highest quality mountain simulator that money can buy. You start off as a pebble of a mountain, but with hard work and dedication, you can grow into a beautfiul, 3d, floating piece of glory. I highly reccommend people to buy this and believe in the powers and wonders of the mountain. In addition to its glorious features, it has the ability to predict weather patterns in your life. For example. when it began to snow in the mountain, it began to snow outside as well! How advanced! The creator must have an application within the program to fetch weather data from some meteorology website. In conclusion, this game will liven up your day, and will defintely fulfill your needs of a realistic mountain simulator.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
												Although my gametime on this particularly clever game is at a low, I assure you that the hours are soon to be racked up. The beginning of the game made me think of three simple things about life that were more complex than I had ever noticed. The deep thought process along with a blank page gave me an open mind ready to take in something. That something was the meaning of three simple words and then i expressed them with art onto my blank canvas. Afterwards my mountain erupted from seemingly... nothing. It was just there. It was all mine to control, not with controls, but with reason. I felt as if the blank pages that i had spread my deep thoughts on had emerged into something greater. Something self-sufficient. Something that knew where it was headed in the future. Trees began growing. Wind began blowing. Precipitation began falling from the universe around me. At first I was not sure, but now i know.. This mountain is my life, my heart, my soul. It is me taking a journey through the world alone.. just waiting for the next time i experience something greater. Something with more feelings than anything I've ever witnessed.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												I got this game yesterday, I didn't really know what to expect. I launched Mountain. My Mountain came to be. I watched MY Mountain. I laughed, I cried, I loved...I hated. While talking to Mountain through musical notes I discovered annihilation. The first time I saved Mountain with not a moment of hesitation. But then I began to torment Mountain. Letting the object of destruction get closer and closer before saving Mountain. As my hatred grew deeper and deeper for Mountain I once again initiated the annihilation sequence a s , z b this time with the intent of ending Mountain once and for all. The object of destruction was beautiful, a massive pulsating eye, it hungered for Mountain. I watched eagerly as the Eye approached, closer and closer it came. Ohhhh how happy I was to finally see Mountain pay, but then something happened. As the Eye was mere seconds away from ending Mountain as I knew Mountain, a single rogue item drifted on to my screen. A heart. I was astounded. Even after all the terrible hatred I vented at Mountain, Mountain loved me. I quickly mashed my keys in an effort to save Mountain and the screen went blank. Through a miracle I had managed to save Mountain. I do not know what happens if you let the object of destruction hit Mountain and I do not plan to find out, nor do I plan to ever see that wretched Eye again. From this day forward I will never stop caring for Mountain, not for even a second. Many of you hate Mountain, but you have not seen the Mountain I know. Live Mountain, be Mountain, and you too shall know Mountain. All you need is patience.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												I got this game yesterday, I didn't really know what to expect. I launched Mountain. My Mountain came to be. I watched MY Mountain. I laughed, I cried, I loved...I hated. While talking to Mountain through musical notes I discovered annihilation. The first time I saved Mountain with not a moment of hesitation. But then I began to torment Mountain. Letting the object of destruction get closer and closer before saving Mountain. As my hatred grew deeper and deeper for Mountain I once again initiated the annihilation sequence a s , z b this time with the intent of ending Mountain once and for all. The object of destruction was beautiful, a massive pulsating eye, it hungered for Mountain. I watched eagerly as the Eye approached, closer and closer it came. Ohhhh how happy I was to finally see Mountain pay, but then something happened. As the Eye was mere seconds away from ending Mountain as I knew Mountain, a single rogue item drifted on to my screen. A heart. I was astounded. Even after all the terrible hatred I vented at Mountain, Mountain loved me. I quickly mashed my keys in an effort to save Mountain and the screen went blank. Through a miracle I had managed to save Mountain. I do not know what happens if you let the object of destruction hit Mountain and I do not plan to find out, nor do I plan to ever see that wretched Eye again. From this day forward I will never stop caring for Mountain, not for even a second. Many of you hate Mountain, but you have not seen the Mountain I know. Live Mountain, be Mountain, and you too shall know Mountain. All you need is patience.

It is (like I have read in many reviews on this game posted before I posted my review about Mountain; so I cite everyone who has said this) a screensaver in a sense. You don't need to touch it. number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												The Game is amazing! You are a giant celestial object, known as a Mountain and your whole purpose is to overcome the cosmic overture that is time. You start out as a mountain, naturally, and you go on through time as, guess what - a mountain. The storyline is amazingly deep and detailed - from the moment you enter the game and create your entity, you can tell that the developers put an insanely large ammount of time into it. I have beat roughly 2% of the game, and I'm still as captivated as ever. None of those fetch quests, or kill x creatures or anything of that sort. These questlines are overflowing with interaction and everything you do (or dont do) affects the overall outcome of the game. I have yet to beat it, talking to the head Mountain atm, he's telling me to go mount in that one place for that one duration... I'll write more when I finish this.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												This is as silly of a review as you can get when it comes to a 'game' like this.So I got this game on a whim because I like having background noise to help me focus.   After getting this, i can say that the ambient sounds, are enjoyable and relaxing.   There are a few intersting points about this game as well.   First, there is a built in piano that you can play.   Two, random occuring events will play out in which random items will crash into your mountion.   Three, its only 99 cents so why not buy it?   Four, the mountion has its own 'thoughts', so you have a virtual buddy who talks to you I guess.Overall, this is not a game, but more of an app that aims to relax and please.   There are no controls aside from the mouse, and the piano keys.   Graphics are good enough.   Sounds are pleasing to the ears.  EDIT:  As for April, 20th 2017, Mountain has had a rather sizeable update.  THe graphics have been amped up in a fairly noticeable way, and a lot more junk and sounds for these items, have been added as well.  Plus, achievements and Steam Cards

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												NOTE: For review with screenshots, please visit http://microfloppy.net/2014/12/06/mountain/Mountain was nominated in the 2014 Game Awards in the category "Games for Change".  Don't let yourself be fooled however: It is not a game that can be played. Mountain is a zero player game; an animated wallpaper.You are born a Mountain, floating through space. You experience the turning of time and seasons. Things crash into you on occation. And you ponder on your existence. You can, to a very limited extent, affect what happens on-screen, but this doesn't extend beyond different animations.The ambient music (mostly wind or rain) is atmospheric, the imagery is pretty, and you can play tunes using your keyboard.I can't say I regret buying it because I had some fun with it and it was only 66c, but it's not something I would recommend anyone buying.2/10 fireflies

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												Pointless indie dreck, status quo etc. I'm honestly sick to death of indie devs phoning it in these days when they could have been something unique and fun. GONE HOME or Always Sometimes Monsters would have been a hell of a lot more engaging if they had more gameplay and stopped huffing their own farts from a paper bag but this is game puts them all to shame on the pretenti-ometer. Its just a ♥♥♥♥ing screensaver. Thats it. It's got a somewhat nice digital piano but at the end of the day is a just a ♥♥♥♥ing screensaver. The games I listed above are hardly games, they have no challenge, no real fail state, and no gameplay really to note. At least with those games you can call them a walking simulator but with this there's nothing to say other than why? Of course as is standard with pointless indie dreck the devs are practically shooting their own farts into their veins in a seedy backally like it was discount heroin. Don't give me the duality of existance crap I took a first year philosophy class in community college too and I can smell the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. You didn't make a game you♥♥♥♥♥♥out a screensaver and wasted everyones time and money, for ♥♥♥♥s sake you can make whatever you want but this is just idiotic. And the worst part? It's not even a well designed screensaver! I noticed my rig was getting pretty warm when I messed around with it and I have a fairly well made system with adequate cooling, I hate to think what would happen to people with lower end rigs. Overall you have a waste of time and money run but pretentious devs that was given the most sumptous review ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ this side of depressionnotagameitsjust♥♥♥♥inghyperlinksquest. So uh, no I do not recommend it.

												Do I recommend this game? That's a bad question, because it implies that this thing is a game. Hell, I'm not even sure what it qualifies as. The best description I can give for it is that it's a glorified screensaver. It does nothing except spin, and occasionally the Mountain gets existential. The player can do nothing except watch. I have no clue why critics are obsessing over it. It's a cute concept, but I have literally seen screensavers that do the same thing. The developer notes on the page are straight up lying when they say that it is a game, or that you can play it, or even that it plays itself.0/10.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												Two CDs hovered just out of my reach, in the far corners of my little universe.I needed those CDs.I was looking at them, just as a humungous pie swung past my mountain in a low orbit.I was hoping the pie would hit, as I needed more pies on my mountain.Then, a GIGANTIC rubber duck flew down, and crashed into my mountain, conveniently next to the gramophone that was playing Albert Bowlly's music.Wow, I thought, That duck is really awesome.My mountain thought "I am lonely"So I played the Yankee Doodle March to it.Then a relatively large hairpin fell out of the sky and landed promptly in the duck's head.Oh dear.Two horses go sailing headfirst into a massive piece of cake.A pin lodges itself in a glowing bottle of liquor.I play more music on the gramophone.My mountain talks to me.I talk to my mountain.This all happened in the space of 3 hours.I love this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												While I do give it a thumbs up, I do it because this "game" is exactly as it is advertised. In Mountain, you draw a couple of things that it asks you to draw, and it supposedly forms a mountain based on it. I do not know how this affects the mountain's generation, but it is there. You can play music notes to speed up time, or make special things happen such as rain blood, or even rain frogs. This does not exactly add to the game's fun, but it is neat to watch. Music also speeds up time, to get out of storms and whatnot. However, "Mountain" is CPU intensive to the point where I could not run any other games with it up. There is nothing to do BUT look at the mountain after all is said and done, and the thoughts it gives are from what I assume a madlib system where it takes a base and adds adjectives. "I FEEL WONDERFUL ON THIS FIERY MORNING." Do I think this game should be $0.99? Not at all. You will play it for a few minutes, then forget about it as it does not entice you to look at it at all. I wish I had not spent the money on it, but I did it because you can be a mountain that floats through space while it is bombarded occaisionally by giant items that stick into it. The clouds also seem to pass right through the mountain as if it were not even there. Take from this what you will, but it is as it is advertised.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												If it's a game, it's not a very good one. If it's a toy, it's not a fun one. It's like Cookie Clicker or other idle games, except there's no clicking and no watching numbers tick up higher and higher. It's like the old Sierra screen-saver, Johnny Castaway, except in Johnny Castaway occasionally interesting things would happen. Mostly it seems to be a neutral object onto which people can project their own emotions and insecurities.Indie pretension, hype, and reviewer snobbery at its most brazen.

It all began on a late Autumn day. The sky was blue and the birds were spry.And on that day, no one, not one, was reading "Catcher in The Rye".And so there was a boy named Jose and his catepillar right?And then the bad guy came and ate Mr Wiggles and Jose was all like, "Ohhh Noooo!" number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												Possibly your most brilliant buy of 2014.  The simplicity of Mountain is deceiving.  Like a lone introvert within a sea of rambunctious heart-throbbing shooters and the thrumming excitement of dating sims, this game will surprise you with the upmost joy of sheer magnificence.  As the fog of worries and "creamy mornings" (quoted from the game), envelop your senses, revelation dawns upon your body.  There will be times where the day will be so wonderful, that you will be happy from just... floating.  There will be days, when you are so occupied with rotating, that you will be surprised that bridges, evil faces, and other countless wonders build themselves upon you.The game does not absorb you.  You do not absorb the game... rather, you will come to understand the significance of this meaningful thought:  "I am absorbed by today."

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												Some will say that this is not a game. Some will say that this is a waste of time. ...This is indeed a game. Not all games require you to arm yourself to the teeth. Not all games require you to solve intricate puzzles. And not all games require you to perform something. A game is something that gives entertainment. And this is entertaining to myself, and many others. It is a relaxing, creative, and ever-changing picture which holds its own unique place amongst the companion games that inhabit this virtual world. But perhaps that was too long for you to care to read. Put simply, this is a special type of game that makes one think and reflect. It is a marvel amongst its own kind.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2014
												Two CDs hovered just out of my reach, in the far corners of my little universe.I needed those CDs.I was looking at them, just as a humungous pie swung past my mountain in a low orbit.I was hoping the pie would hit, as I needed more pies on my mountain.Then, a GIGANTIC rubber duck flew down, and crashed into my mountain, conveniently next to the gramophone that was playing Albert Bowlly's music.Wow, I thought, That duck is really awesome.My mountain thought "I am lonely"So I played the Yankee Doodle March to it.Then a relatively large hairpin fell out of the sky and landed promptly in the duck's head.Oh dear.Two horses go sailing headfirst into a massive piece of cake.A pin lodges itself in a glowing bottle of liquor.I play more music on the gramophone.My mountain talks to me.I talk to my mountain.This all happened in the space of 3 hours.I love this game.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
												"Mountain" isn't necessarily a game about the weather, or a game about things falling on a mountain. Simply put, it is a game that serves as a place for meditation and self-reflection. You can think of it as a substitute for that one place in your childhood that you always felt safe in.Not only is "Mountain" a game of self-reflection, it is a well thought out idea that, in my opinion, promotes setting time aside and devoting it to peaceful silence.Mountain is quite possibly one of the best VR games I have ever stumbled upon. You can rest assured it is capable of being the most life changing game you will ever play.Just know, this game is not meant for those looking to play a game -- it is meant for those looking for a truly life changing experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												Um well, this is a different take on the concept of "game".  You have a mountain which rotates and accumulates random objects (the first object to crash into my mountain was an umbrella -- wtf, how did an umbrella get into space is what I want to know).  On occasion, the mountain thinks very mountain-y thoughts, like "I'm diggin' on this storm!" or "Hey wow this spooky night is the bomb!" (paraphrased).  The player can pick up the random objects and set them down again (exciting).  Other than that, I'm not sure if this "game" does anything else -- well, there are the musical notes one can play which sound pretty nice when scrolled way out, so that's a thing.  All in all -- I shouldn't like this "game", but I sorta do, but honestly as it is I can't recommend it. Sure, it's kind of zen to just look into it from time to time and see what other crap your mound of spacedirt has picked up, but there's just not anything else to it.  I hope some civilizations evolve or something like that to break up the monotony, but maybe that's too much to hope for.  Maybe worth getting only when it's far less than 99 cents; I kind of feel like I overpaid.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												It is exactly as it describes in the title, with a little added bonus. Don't expect a huge fun game when buying this. It is a screensaver. A lot of people complain that you aren't actually "God". But you are. "God" gets to sit and watch us mess up the world, without being able to do anything about it. And that is exactly what happens in this game. You watch the mountain grow/be destroyed, and you cannot do a damn thing. I love it. I run it in the background while I work because the nature sounds are nice and enjoyable, and I like to tab to it to check on my mountain. I also keep it on while I sleep, so that I can look at it if I wake up, and it will slowly relax me and I can fall asleep. I love this screensaver "game" and I feel like people like me will enjoy it too. It's cute and calming. It's also good for panic attacks. Nice job, Devs. :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												It is what it is, don't get mad that you didn't do any research before you spent a dollar on something that you had no idea what it was going to be. Personnally I really liked this. It is basically a screen saver, except it feels alive.      I started to feel attached to the mountain I had made, I even found out a way to remove junk from my mountain by throwing it off, or by playing a melody. I was devastated when I played the melody from Close Encounters. My mountain was destroyed by the eye of blindness, it was sad. I ocasionally I leave this running in the background just to see if anything will happen. Its not a game, but its not really anything else other than a game. Just like making Bonsai trees isn't really like being a full-on gardener, but it basically is.       Worth the $1? I don't know, you decide. It's not hard to figure out if you will hate this or appreciate this. I was glad I got it. If it's a game, then it is a really ammusing cheap take on what games are and how we play them (like Little Inferno). If it's a screen saver, then it is a really good interactive screen saver that has way more depth, beauty, and humor than any screensaver I have ever used.       I will give it a thumbs up but you don't have to, and thats okay, just don't buy ignorantly and then complain. It is what it is and you are not forced to buy it. Just ask the mountain what he thinks of himself, he will tell you, and in a very contemplative way too.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												It's strange... I love this, it's something nice to relax to. Unlike what most people say, no, it's not a screensaver, it's a game... Just not a game of direct interaction. Things happen, you don't play the game, the game simply plays itself. Ooh! It's snowing on my mountain! Somewhat like those life simulator games, like Sims or Animal Crossing without the intervening of the godlike player. It's also good to do homework by, something kind of distracting... Hey, look, fireflies! But not too distracting to keep you from working. If you have a telivision in your living room with a computer, it's perfect for when guests come over and you want them to socialize. Better than sports. I hate sports. The developer behind this game took good care to make sure the Mountain's thoughts correspond appropriately to what's happening, something which most game developers leave out. In other words, as the kiddies say nowadays: "Gr8, m8! 8/8!"

												This game is very nice. Very very atmospheric and ambient.Keyboard is a piano. The mountain talks to you. It's pretty damn nice. Best 99 cents i've ever spent to be honest.In terms of gameplay... there is none. Sometimes random things will pop up on your mountain and the weather and seasons change. New trees grow. content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
												"Mountain" isn't necessarily a game about the weather, or a game about things falling on a mountain. Simply put, it is a game that serves as a place for meditation and self-reflection. You can think of it as a substitute for that one place in your childhood that you always felt safe in.Not only is "Mountain" a game of self-reflection, it is a well thought out idea that, in my opinion, promotes setting time aside and devoting it to peaceful silence.Mountain is quite possibly one of the best VR games I have ever stumbled upon. You can rest assured it is capable of being the most life changing game you will ever play.Just know, this game is not meant for those looking to play a game -- it is meant for those looking for a truly life changing experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												Mountain, a brilliant game of unprecedented architecture. The game is widely known as a so-called "Mountain Simulator," but it is so much more. I remember the day like it was yesterday, my wife had left me and I had nothing but a dollar, a laptop, and my Steam account. I drank so much back then, shot after shot, it did nothing. While drunk, I pulled out my phone and bought this game which is called Mountain. Once sober, I opened my computer to see that I used my last dollar to buy a stupid game. I was ashamed, this led to more drinking. It eventually led to more than the hard liquor. I stole Cocaine, Valium, and Vicodin. I was addicted. I didn't know what to do. I finally opened Mountain after a long line of Coke. Then it hit me. The game was speaking to me. Not literally, but almost telepathically. After a couple of weeks, I sobered up nicely, got a job, and finally lived in a place that I could call home. I owe everything to Mountain. I give it 0/5

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												While many games brag about their massive scope and seemingly realistic environments, no "game" has ever changed the way I live and think like Mountain has. This celestial screensaver has connected with me on deeper levels than other video game character, and possibly even another human, has ever done before. When the mountain was bored, I was bored. Never has a connection been so parallel and perpendicular at the same time. That doesn't really make much sense, but neither does Mountain. Before you buy, ask yourself : "What is a lonely space mountain to do?" This game will answer that one question.

The sound is the standout feature, but everything else is great, too.A true revolution in the genre with that rare universal appeal nearly gone from modern life and rarely even seen in video games - a kind of appeal that only Tetris, the Beatles, or Jesus Christ could even hope to rival. Not just culturally, but morally and physically.11/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												Mountain is an interesting game to say the least. You have very minimal interaction with a mountain that is completely cut off from the rest of the world stranded in space. Despite only being able to move the camera and rearrange the space junk (That consists of horses, arrows, and trash cans) you find yourself attached to your mountain. The little comments that it writes giving the inanimate object a personality. Eventually you bond with mountain, realizing that there is more to mountain than your first thought. You bond over your mutual enjoyment of the weather. You help mountain rearrange its space junk, or treasures as you call them. Eventually an old music box is given to you from the space trash man and you begin to call it your precious. The voices whisper to you. They tell you how Mountain isn't has nice as it seems. But precious plays music that soothes you, it counsels the inner voices. But the inner voices start yelling instead of whispering to be heard over the voices. They tell you what mountain is planning. Mountain wants your precious. You know you can’t stop Mountain. In a futile attempt to halt the hand of fate you hit every key until it all stops and you have no control. A wild dwarf star approaches. In what feels like an eternity but is only a few seconds your friend is gone. Forever lost to the cold void of space. And you feel guilt. You mourn Mountain. This game took me through an emotional rollercoaster. All and all worth the dollar.

Games can be whatever they want to be, screw strict construction, go indie!

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												The best .99 cents I have ever spent. With an intricate set of controls like: NothingThis game comes to life as you sometimes find random objects such as a bendy straw, a baseball, or maybe even a girlfriend appear on your mountain. Perhaps a deeper meaning is hidden within the game. For example, the game depicts a mountain floating in space all by its lonesome, in what appears to be a life of solitude. Is this not what we all are? Mountains floating in space all alone? This game asks the real questions we want to know by simply not asking questions at all.Pros:Intricate ControlsBeautiful StorylineComplex CharactersCons:No controlsNo StorylineNo CharactersOverall: 11/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 26, 2015
												Mountain, a brilliant game of unprecedented architecture. The game is widely known as a so-called "Mountain Simulator," but it is so much more. I remember the day like it was yesterday, my wife had left me and I had nothing but a dollar, a laptop, and my Steam account. I drank so much back then, shot after shot, it did nothing. While drunk, I pulled out my phone and bought this game which is called Mountain. Once sober, I opened my computer to see that I used my last dollar to buy a stupid game. I was ashamed, this led to more drinking. It eventually led to more than the hard liquor. I stole Cocaine, Valium, and Vicodin. I was addicted. I didn't know what to do. I finally opened Mountain after a long line of Coke. Then it hit me. The game was speaking to me. Not literally, but almost telepathically. After a couple of weeks, I sobered up nicely, got a job, and finally lived in a place that I could call home. I owe everything to Mountain. I give it 0/5

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												Mountain is an interesting game to say the least. You have very minimal interaction with a mountain that is completely cut off from the rest of the world stranded in space. Despite only being able to move the camera and rearrange the space junk (That consists of horses, arrows, and trash cans) you find yourself attached to your mountain. The little comments that it writes giving the inanimate object a personality. Eventually you bond with mountain, realizing that there is more to mountain than your first thought. You bond over your mutual enjoyment of the weather. You help mountain rearrange its space junk, or treasures as you call them. Eventually an old music box is given to you from the space trash man and you begin to call it your precious. The voices whisper to you. They tell you how Mountain isn't has nice as it seems. But precious plays music that soothes you, it counsels the inner voices. But the inner voices start yelling instead of whispering to be heard over the voices. They tell you what mountain is planning. Mountain wants your precious. You know you can’t stop Mountain. In a futile attempt to halt the hand of fate you hit every key until it all stops and you have no control. A wild dwarf star approaches. In what feels like an eternity but is only a few seconds your friend is gone. Forever lost to the cold void of space. And you feel guilt. You mourn Mountain. This game took me through an emotional rollercoaster. All and all worth the dollar.

content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												The best .99 cents I have ever spent. With an intricate set of controls like: NothingThis game comes to life as you sometimes find random objects such as a bendy straw, a baseball, or maybe even a girlfriend appear on your mountain. Perhaps a deeper meaning is hidden within the game. For example, the game depicts a mountain floating in space all by its lonesome, in what appears to be a life of solitude. Is this not what we all are? Mountains floating in space all alone? This game asks the real questions we want to know by simply not asking questions at all.Pros:Intricate ControlsBeautiful StorylineComplex CharactersCons:No controlsNo StorylineNo CharactersOverall: 11/10

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												When I read about the concept I was really excited as it sounded intriguing and different. The game graphs were simple but nice, the melody-actions were cool (but I found the keyboard notes a bit restricted). I enjoyed the first hours of gameplay, even when there´s not much real gameplay at all: You basically watch your mountain. After a while I started losing interest, basically because I didn´t feel the thoughts the mountain shared had anything to do with the events happening (either triggered by the melodies, or by the supposed time of day or season, or by whether I was keeping the mountain open or not). Then garbage started falling on my mountain, garbage that apparently from falling on again, had no purpose and couldn´t be removed. I really disliked this. Eventually I left the game running to see whether the mountain would suffocate in garbage (if so, I really hoped it would happen soon). It did. This morning I found a message notifying total destruction (no further details, no final view). The concept is sort of different and I don´t consider the money a complete waste. But I wouldn´t really recommend this.Maybe if I had looked more into forums I would have found more things to do. Maybe I didn´t play this as it was supposed to be played. But right now I uninstalled the game as I don´t really feel like playing it again. When it was peaceful and clean it was ok. When garbage started falling, it got as stressing as dealing with a Tamagochi who demands care while all you´re able to do is watch it die.

Posted: August 25, 2014
												This game is a brilliant satire of art games. There's no control over it, no objective, nothing. Your mountain "thinks" out nonsensical lines of text pieced together by an RNG. This game tries really hard to feel "deep" but makes it very clear that it has nothing to say, and that's the joke. What's sad is that the sheer number of people who think this game is legit kind of shows how far art games have fallen.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												This is my mountain. There are many like it, but this one is mine. My mountain is my best friend. It is my life. I must master it as I must master my life. My mountain, without me, is useless. Without my mountain, I am useless. I must watch my mountain true. I must watch fonder than my fellow gamers who are trying to out-feel me. I must out-feel him before he out-feels me. I will...My mountain and I know that what counts in life is not the weather we endure, the noise of our rain, nor the fog we make. We know that it is the feels that count. We will feel...My mountain is human, even as I, because it is my life. Thus, I will learn it as a brother. I will learn its weaknesses, its strength, its landscape, its environment, its foliage and its weird crap that gets lodged in it. I will keep my mountain game installed and open, even as I am installed and open. We will become part of each other. We will...Before God, I swear this creed. My mountain and I are the things that exist. We are the masters of our existence. We are the saviors of my life.So be it, until enlightenment is everyone's and there are no console scrubs, but Mountain!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												When I read about the concept I was really excited as it sounded intriguing and different. The game graphs were simple but nice, the melody-actions were cool (but I found the keyboard notes a bit restricted). I enjoyed the first hours of gameplay, even when there´s not much real gameplay at all: You basically watch your mountain. After a while I started losing interest, basically because I didn´t feel the thoughts the mountain shared had anything to do with the events happening (either triggered by the melodies, or by the supposed time of day or season, or by whether I was keeping the mountain open or not). Then garbage started falling on my mountain, garbage that apparently from falling on again, had no purpose and couldn´t be removed. I really disliked this. Eventually I left the game running to see whether the mountain would suffocate in garbage (if so, I really hoped it would happen soon). It did. This morning I found a message notifying total destruction (no further details, no final view). The concept is sort of different and I don´t consider the money a complete waste. But I wouldn´t really recommend this.Maybe if I had looked more into forums I would have found more things to do. Maybe I didn´t play this as it was supposed to be played. But right now I uninstalled the game as I don´t really feel like playing it again. When it was peaceful and clean it was ok. When garbage started falling, it got as stressing as dealing with a Tamagochi who demands care while all you´re able to do is watch it die.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												Best game ever 2016!!!!!!!!!11111111111oneoneonetwoCampaign-Very rich storyline with a very complex backstory that can take up hours of your life while you try to figure it out. While I'm falling asleep, in the shower, on a long car journey or simply on the toilet I like to think about the story of this game. There are many different decisions for you to make in this game leading to 7 possible endings.Multiplayer-All diamond SMGs now, working towards my shotguns, very unique gamemodes and killstreaks make for an exciting and different style of FPS. The devastator mech does seem to be a little OP and should be nerfed as it seemes to obliterate anything within range.Co-op missions-Over 50 different missions for you to try with up to four friends that can be replayed on 3 different  difficulties. The levelling system carries over from multiplayer (100 levels, 10 prestiges) each mission gives you around 100,00xp which can get you from level 1 to level 5 in one game but it's likely you won't complete a mission until you're at least level 30.Raid bosses- The raid bosses in this game are possibly my favourite part. They can take up to an hour if you trying them at the recommended level but rarely defeated unless you have a full lobby of prestige 6 or aboves. The final raid boss still is undefeated by me as I'm only presige 9, level 20. Getting pretty close though.Zombie survival-Most violent thing I have ever seen. Must be 18.In conclusion this game is incredibly violent but very enjoyable. I highly recommend that you buy it even if you're not normally into strategic first person shooters but I do have one more warning:strong sexual themes and constant nudity.99/10

content:
Posted: June 26, 2016
												Mountain isn't a game, it's an expierience. Don't buy it expecting hours on end of exciting gameplay. There is no gameplay, only a surreal atmospheric simulation mountain experience. Leave mountain running in the background when you play other games, or as a screensaver, and switch back to it and play whenever you feel like. See how your mountain changes as you leave it to discover itself. Come back and observe all the little details. Play with the music keyboard and create an atmosphere for you and your mountain to enjoy. Learn things about your mountain. Learn things about yourself. Become your mountain.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
												A really short but atmospheric game for sure. Don't rush, you have to experience the surroundings to get clues about the story and move forward. Yeah it's a walking simulator but also a good thriller/detective story. Some clues are more obvious than others but in the end, if you reach the final point in the story, you will even get a help (literally). I can't really talk about the story because... there are so many questions. Also it's really easy to spoil everything. If you like movies/games where you left with several questions in the end and it's up to your interpretation what the story was about then I recommend this game because you will enjoy it.Also it's not a horror game even tho it has a cold and dark feeling. There is only one scarry part but even that can be avoidable if you aware of your surroundings.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												I usually don't write reviews for games but considering what this is I feel the need to review this masterpiece of a game.For several weeks now I have always had the same routine: Turn pc on, go to my steam library, open up muntain and reflect on the choices I've made in my life and what choices I will make in the future.For most this is just a screensaver of a lonely mountain, but for me it's a phychological look at the human mind and the many questions surrounding us. "What are we doing?" "What do we do?" "How do I do it?" "What is the point of all this?" All these questions have been in our heads at least once in our life and never have we had answers to them.The interaction we have with this mountain may be minimal, but the same applies with us and the outside world. We can't change nature. Life goes on and we live to see that, and in mountain we see day turn to night, leaves on the trees fall and snow falling on the mountain. The world around us changes regularly but does the mountain change at all?The only possible interaction we do have with the mountain is pressing keys to play tune to make time go fast. This touched me emotionally. As the saying goes, "Life goes by when you're having fun" and mountain conveys this perfectly.This game is the most deep, phychological game that I've had the pleasure play.10/10 David OReilly needs to make more games like this.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
												Mountain is, as many have pointed out, a screensaver. However, being a screensaver is not necessarily a negative thing. Initially, I was intrigued at the idea of having a sort of "passive" experience in gaming, one where I take on the role of observer and watch something grow and change with only minor interference from the player. Mountain is very much a good concept; it can be played in the same style as games like Cookie Clicker (that is, with minimal attention and concentration) and offers some small amount of creative outlet without being demanding. Unfortunately, Mountain's execution falls short of its potential.Users begin Mountain with a blank slate in the form of a grassy green hill. Interactions with the mountain are limited to a button used to coax a thought from the mountain, a click of of the mouse that lets you rearrange objects on your mountain, and a set of keys on the keyboard that act like the keys on a piano, allowing you to play cute little melodies that can speed the changing of seasons for your mountain. Leaving Mountain on in the background will cause procedurally generated objects to sprout on  your mountain. My mountain quickly gained a gramophone, a traffic cone, a chair,  and a paper airplane.Subsequent hours added more items, each one random and briefly curiosity-provoking, but not quite as exciting or as thoughtful as I had hoped. Despite the new items and the changes and season and weather, I never found myself all that interested in what was happening with my mountain. When I finally came home from work one day and found that my mountain had perished to some cataclysmic event, I was momentarily frustrated that I hadn't been able to see my mountain's demise. After that moment passed, though, I almost felt something akin to relief.What I had expected out of Mountain was something the game fails to deliver: a sense of fondness for my mountain. While the mountain's charming little thoughts and quips often made me smile, overall I finished the lifespan of my mountain with a sense of non-tragic boredom. I had hoped to start with a small little hill and watch it grow and shift and change into a fully functional, planetoid mountain. I thought perhaps I would get to see lakes form and forests grow and maybe even a species or two develop. I had hoped I would fall in love with this little screensaver. Instead, all I got was a mountain that never changed its shape and whose various objects held only a very brief passing fancy.

You must appreciate my art!"People may praise this game, but I suspect a case of The Emperor's New Clothes. There is nothing here of note. It's an EXTREMELY simple program that has an inflated sense of worth because the creator told you it had worth. Then reviewers told you it was amazing, too, because they were worried about being seen as "not getting it" or "not being smart enough" or "not culturally inclined."It's a boring, simple simulation and I have no idea why people would pay $1 for it.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												Mountain is a metaphor for life: barren, purposeless, spinning around in circles. That's how Mountain looked like at first but look closer and you will see all the trees, rocks and flowers growing around it. And isn't life just like that? We often neglect things that we already have.We sometimes feel stuck, with nothing good happening in our life. Every day is the same as the day before it. That's how Mountain is like as well if you just keep staring at it. But go back to it an hour or so later and you may be surprised to find a giant dice has landed on it. Doesn't life surprise us much in the same way as well?And the mountain's incline? It represents the challenges that we have to overcome to reach the peak of our potential. Often it may seem unreachable, just like how the peak of Mountain is usually covered in clouds. But at the perfect moment, the clouds pass by and you can see the beautiful future ahead of you.If you zoom out far enough, you can see Mountain covered in bright light, and the entire universe surrounding it. This implies how small we are at life and that there is an entire universe out there to explore and experience. Mountain is imploring us to go out there and make the most out of the short time given to us.As I close this game and go to sleep tonight, I know deep in my heart that I have grown to be a better man. Thank you Mountain for making me realize life's true meaning.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												Finally the time has come to review this amazing game. I have spent hours after hours with this game and I have loved every second of it. Mountain has unparallel storytelling that immerses you into the highly detailed story. You will surely spend hours just admiring the complex but interesting storytelling. I'm guessing that it is written by really talented writers and it has taken a long time.The voice acting in this game sounds really natural and it fits really well into the theme of the game. The graphical quality is top-notch, but you can easily get reasonable framerates with an older CPU and GPU.  I would definitely recommend playing in 4K for maximum enjoyment. The audio quality is eargasmic when listening in 7.1 or even 5.1 surround sound systems.Would definitely recommend trying Oculus Rift and if you like using a controller, no worries since this game has it covered.The multiplayer is something you should try, but I feel like it has some polishing. For me there have been no network issues and bugs have been minimal.My personal score is 9,8 / 10You should buy it, you won't regret it.

content:
Posted: January 1
Product received for free
												Please listen, this is NOT a game. I REPEAT, THIS IS NOT A GAME. Stop calling it a game, thank you.Do not purchase it thinking that it is a game because it is not. My friend got this for me and I did not expect much. And most of what I did in the first 20 minutes is basically stare at a rotating mountain. That is basically what you do and this is something to relax. Reading a guide I found out about some pretty cool things which were nice and I want to go back and check it out more but I have to write this review because this recieves undeserved hate from people who believed it was a game. Most I can say honestly is that this is something to relax and think. It's hard to think of things to describe it and I am not the best person to do so but as of right now this is something I do recommend BUT to only a certain group of people. I legitimately can't recommend it to a large group of people because chances are, they expect something more and that's not how this is meant to be taken. If you enjoy pondering about the world and anything philosophical or something of the sorts then I think you should give it a shot. Or if you want to just gift it to a friend for the hell of it then I think the asking price is worth it.

												I tried to stay open minded with this game but in the end I found it impossible. It seems like a game that was designed to trick people into thinking you were getting something by calling it creative or innovative. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2014
												While I am all for creative ideas in game design that are often bizarre, experimental or would only be executed by independent developers, Mountain is a clear cut example as to why not all ideas should have a price tag put on them.I have spent almost four hours 'playing' Mountain, though that clocked time was mostly me doing something else while the game ran off to the side. That's because Mountain is an interactive screensaver. Nothing more, nothing less, even if the genres on its Steam store page incorrectly label it as a 'simulation' and 'RPG'. Mountain does attempt to foster actual interaction by allowing you to play musical notes on your keyboard which when a correct sequence is played (Hot Cross Buns, Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, etc), you can cause various effects to rain down on your mountain, like hearts, fireballs or in morbid manner, blood. These effects are only visual, unfortunately, and gameplay in Mountain doesn't improve from there. You can use your mouse to look around your mountain, spin it or zoom in and out for a closer and more distant look, and cleverly enough you can briskly shake your mountain to clear away clouds if you want a clear look at your personal piece of rock (despite the trees and other textures looking incredibly poor). Oh, random space debris will also fly in and crash into your mountain, like a traffic cone, a child's toy block, a futuristic sphere and other oddities that you can then move around or throw away. Why? Video games!Mountain falls apart at the seams once you realize you've exhausted these gameplay elements (and I use that term loosely), since the only progression in the game is the passing of time, the weather and seasons in your little bubble of an atmosphere, since zooming out will reveal your mountain is floating in space for reasons I still can't figure out. Apparently your mountain has emotions and sentience, since every few minutes it will make an observation or statement about the current weather, time of day and how it feels, even if during the night it will claim to be nervous one minute, and then another claim it feels bold from the darkness. Another 'thought' your mountain can have is some kind of existential question or statement regarding its existence, why its out here in space, if the player is a voice inside its head, why is it alone, are there other mountains like it, etc. and so forth (you can also press period to force one of these thoughts if yo﻿u don't want to wait). Apparently this is what has attracted players and journalists to the game, supposedly eliciting emotions and 'feels' from your mountain having a crisis of its own sentience and having to cope and adapt with the bizarre circumstances it finds itself in while 'living' day by day, season by season.﻿The glaring flaw in trying to stir thoughts in the player this way is that Mountain is still a screensaver. Nothing more, nothing less. I've tried to find something positive to say about Mountain, but excluding being able to shake your mountain to clear the clouds being clever, I have nothing. Mountain feels like it's trying to be something unique, but it ends up looking utterly ridiculous and full of itself in the process, and the fact that it carries a price tag doesn't help its case. Yes, ninety-nine cents is a piddly amount which could easily be raised by selling Steam cards, but charging money for screensaver under the guise of an 'ambient procedural mountain game' is an absolute joke, where the punch-line is on the consumer.In no way can I recommend Mountain, even at the price of being a penny shy of a dollar. It is a waste of time, money and patience from the four hours I burned away on this game, trying to make sense of it and realize what the positive talk of it was about.﻿

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
												This Isn't Really A Game Yet It's Not A Glorified Screensaver. It's A Exprience That Can't Be Explained Properly Which Will Explain Why The Number One Review On This "Game" Is Just The Word "Good". It's Like Looking After A Pet Rock But It's Bigger And Makes You Think. Through Most Of The Negative Reviews May Pass It Off As A Horrible Cash In Or As A Bad Simulation, It's Because They Don't Think. They Just Pass Through Life Without Considering The Effics Of Their Existence And This May Sound Stupid From A Guy Who Calls Himself "Boobs DxD" But I Use The Name For Irony's Sake But I Digress. The "Game" Will Prompt You To Read And Think Time To Time With Obervasations Of The Current State Of The Mountain And Ask Questions That Question It's Existance And Loneness Which In Turn Connects With Me. As Someone Who Suffers From Social Anxiety And Depression, This "Game" Made Me Think Why I'm Like The Way I Am. Apart From That, Debris Will Crash Into Your Mountain Such As Hearts, Planes Or Horses. My First Debris Came An Hour In As One Of Those Early Phones And More Comes In By The Hour. You Would Eventually Have Your Mountain Covered In Debris. You Can Play Music On Your Keyboard Which Can Be Used To Stop The Murdurous Dwarf Star From Destroying Your Mountain And Making You Restart.I Would Describe What All These Things Stand For But I Think Its Better For You To Get The "Game" And See What You Get As Everyone Has Their Own Thoughts And Perspective On Life. It's Only 99c Which Is A Good Start But It Needs Help On Finding It's Target Audience Since It's Not Really Suited For Steam Where Most Games Are Action Based. Before Leaving This Review Here, I Want To Ponda On One Last Thing With You. This Game Has A Season And Day/Night Cycle. It Goes Through This Without Stopping And The Only Way To Truely Stop It Is By Entering The Option Menu. This Can Have Many Different Interpatations But Mine Is That This "Game" Is A Metaphor For Life. It Acts Like A Wake Up Call And With It's Simple But Beautiful Art Direction, It Kinda Prompts You To Leave Your Computer And Explore The Outside World And This Is Why It Appeals To Me. In Conclusion, This Is A "Game" That Provokes Discussion. I Usually Buy Games For My Steam Friends For Christmas And This Year, I'm Going To Send Them This Because It Would Be Nice To See How Other People See It. Games Allow Us To Escape Reality With Examples Like GTA's Gangsta Lifestyle Or With No Man Sky's Space Exploration And This "Game" Is Something That Pulls From That Reality And Makes Us Think About The Real Life We Have Been Given Before Us, Make Us Go Back In Time To A Time When People Only Had Nature To Entertain Them Nad When You Think About It, Nature Is One Of The Reasons Why Evolution And Our Pursuit For Techlogy Lead Us To Where We Are Today. In A Simple Statment, It's Just A Nice Little Tool That Reminds Us There's More To Life. Now Excuse Me While I Go And Play Painkiller.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2014
												Firstly, I feel I should point out that I don't hate this. This is exactly the right price point for this sort of thing -- "Hey," it says, "you can buy that soda, OR you could buy an almost non-interactive experimental existentialist experience that might stick with you for a while, like an ant farm that occasionally sprouts a keyboard from its side and asks you whether this is truly all there is to life."It's not something I can in good conscience recommend that another human being PURCHASE, mostly because I'm an adult and I can be haunted by existentialist concerns for free whenever I feel like it, but if you want to put something surreal and vaguely upsetting in your life, you can do worse than Mountain.

Posted: August 24, 2014
												The game's description:"Leave it open - it's designed to run in the periphery of your life. Only interact with it when you feel like it. You can play Mountain while playing other games. If you are not playing it, it will play itself."It's not a game, it's a screensaver. Leaving a mountain to like have like plants grow on it, people build things, animals do things, etc. and checking back every so often to see what cool things have popped up would actually kind of be a cool concept.Left it running for 8 hours. The mountain currently has some mushrooms, a tennis ball stuck in it, a ball of fire, a gramaphone, a pitchfork, an arrow, and the earth.I had more fun drawing three things at the beginning (determines the seed generation or something).0/10 DIY "Mountain" guide: draw a mountain in MS Paint. Leave it running. Come back and gawk how this "breaks the mold of video games"

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												Hello, my name is WoozieMoo, I am a fairly avid gamer, though not on Steam. I mostly play League Of Legends, which is not available on the Steam network. But, I'm not here to level us on a first name basis, I am here to announce a surefire 2015 Game of The Year award winner. Truly, nothing has been more deserving in the short history of gaming to win this prestigous award; The Mountain, at first, seemed like a waste of money. Never again will I question the amazing experience that is this game. The Mountain has successfully changed my entire view on life, this Mountain is my compainion when I feel alone, it's the light in the dark, it has guided me through some tough times.Do not believe those who say this game is merely a screensaver, this game is much better than any game on the market for a much better deal. Denounce Far Cry 4 from your Christmas list and instead buy at least 50 copies of Mountain and gift them to everyone you know so that this existential experience may be shared with more than one person at a time.10/10, must, must play again.

Posted: August 24, 2014
												The game's description:"Leave it open - it's designed to run in the periphery of your life. Only interact with it when you feel like it. You can play Mountain while playing other games. If you are not playing it, it will play itself."It's not a game, it's a screensaver. Leaving a mountain to like have like plants grow on it, people build things, animals do things, etc. and checking back every so often to see what cool things have popped up would actually kind of be a cool concept.Left it running for 8 hours. The mountain currently has some mushrooms, a tennis ball stuck in it, a ball of fire, a gramaphone, a pitchfork, an arrow, and the earth.I had more fun drawing three things at the beginning (determines the seed generation or something).0/10 DIY "Mountain" guide: draw a mountain in MS Paint. Leave it running. Come back and gawk how this "breaks the mold of video games"

content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
												This Isn't Really A Game Yet It's Not A Glorified Screensaver. It's A Exprience That Can't Be Explained Properly Which Will Explain Why The Number One Review On This "Game" Is Just The Word "Good". It's Like Looking After A Pet Rock But It's Bigger And Makes You Think. Through Most Of The Negative Reviews May Pass It Off As A Horrible Cash In Or As A Bad Simulation, It's Because They Don't Think. They Just Pass Through Life Without Considering The Effics Of Their Existence And This May Sound Stupid From A Guy Who Calls Himself "Boobs DxD" But I Use The Name For Irony's Sake But I Digress. The "Game" Will Prompt You To Read And Think Time To Time With Obervasations Of The Current State Of The Mountain And Ask Questions That Question It's Existance And Loneness Which In Turn Connects With Me. As Someone Who Suffers From Social Anxiety And Depression, This "Game" Made Me Think Why I'm Like The Way I Am. Apart From That, Debris Will Crash Into Your Mountain Such As Hearts, Planes Or Horses. My First Debris Came An Hour In As One Of Those Early Phones And More Comes In By The Hour. You Would Eventually Have Your Mountain Covered In Debris. You Can Play Music On Your Keyboard Which Can Be Used To Stop The Murdurous Dwarf Star From Destroying Your Mountain And Making You Restart.I Would Describe What All These Things Stand For But I Think Its Better For You To Get The "Game" And See What You Get As Everyone Has Their Own Thoughts And Perspective On Life. It's Only 99c Which Is A Good Start But It Needs Help On Finding It's Target Audience Since It's Not Really Suited For Steam Where Most Games Are Action Based. Before Leaving This Review Here, I Want To Ponda On One Last Thing With You. This Game Has A Season And Day/Night Cycle. It Goes Through This Without Stopping And The Only Way To Truely Stop It Is By Entering The Option Menu. This Can Have Many Different Interpatations But Mine Is That This "Game" Is A Metaphor For Life. It Acts Like A Wake Up Call And With It's Simple But Beautiful Art Direction, It Kinda Prompts You To Leave Your Computer And Explore The Outside World And This Is Why It Appeals To Me. In Conclusion, This Is A "Game" That Provokes Discussion. I Usually Buy Games For My Steam Friends For Christmas And This Year, I'm Going To Send Them This Because It Would Be Nice To See How Other People See It. Games Allow Us To Escape Reality With Examples Like GTA's Gangsta Lifestyle Or With No Man Sky's Space Exploration And This "Game" Is Something That Pulls From That Reality And Makes Us Think About The Real Life We Have Been Given Before Us, Make Us Go Back In Time To A Time When People Only Had Nature To Entertain Them Nad When You Think About It, Nature Is One Of The Reasons Why Evolution And Our Pursuit For Techlogy Lead Us To Where We Are Today. In A Simple Statment, It's Just A Nice Little Tool That Reminds Us There's More To Life. Now Excuse Me While I Go And Play Painkiller.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												This game brought me out of a dark time in my life. Early on as a child I had a bad experience with a mountain. One time I was hiking and then the mountain took everything I love, my life was gone in an instant. I had been traumatized ever since. For years, my friends, family, even teachers mocked me. I was ashamed to be who I was, to express my feelings. I hid under a cover of darkness. Everyday I'd try not to be seen, but my actions only ended in more despair. I wished for someone, something to help me. Then I found this game. My life turned around. I overcame my fear and took life into my own hands. I had come out triumphant, victorious in a way of life. I was the mountain. The mountain was me. And I was happy.

Product received for free
General ImpressionsMountain is a $0.99 experience that you can get as part of the E3 2016 Humble Bundle Experience, and stands at $0.99 on a usual day. The program features a low-poly mountain, some trees, and some ambient noises to set the mood. You are able to make some sounds from typing on your keyboard, but you get what you paid for. I would not purchase it for gaming though.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												First off, if you see any review that has a playtime of less than an hour, ignore it because it's more than likely a child crying in impotent rage about how "dis game dum" simply because their feeble brain can't handle a concept like this.With that being said, this isn't a game in the traditional sense. If you're expecting exxxtreme mountain action, well, you won't find any. I think calling it a game is rather inaccurate but, that's still okay.However, this is still a pretty neato piece of work. When you start the program, it presents words or questions to you and then has you draw something. The drawings are used as seeds to generate your mountain, to make each mountain unique.The idea is to just leave it running all the time, and you check on it whenever you want. I leave it minimized or off to the side, and then just completely disable the noise if I'm going to play another video game. The ambient noise the program makes is also very pleasant for general computer tasks. You can control the type of ambient noise by zooming in or out of your mountain, to get rainy/windy noises to a tao/zen like sound for outer space.As you check your mountain, you'll find more and more items piling up on it. As of this writing (and leaving it running for 12 hours), I've got a clock, a top-hat, a barbell, a biplane, and a cement brick. You can interact with these by clicking on the object and holding it down, and you can either toss it back out to space or redrop it somewhere else on the mountain.Various things will grow as well, and so far I've got various kinds of oakish and pine type trees going. You'll also get different kinds of weather going as well, depending on however the hell your mountain feels.There will be an audio cue at random, at which point a "thought" will pop up. The thoughts oddly put a smile on my face :). You can provoke "thoughts" as well by hitting '.' (the period key).So in summary, it's a really weird concept at first, but the key really is to just leave it running all the time. This piece is totally worth a dollar, maybe even more than that cause of how cool it is :)

												This game will leave you with a profound sense of zen.Although there is little you can do but observe for the first few minutes, it's still a fully immersive experience. When you're bored, play around with the musical notes and see if you can unlock the different modes. Turn down the graphical settings (to avoid overheating your GPU/CPU) and leave it to run while you're away. You'll be pleasantly surprised at how different your mountain is every time.Well worth the money. I would highly recommend this.

Posted: October 15, 2014
												Mountain... where to start? It's a screen saver that changes over time.  You can save the state, and interact with it.  Your interactions result in feedback.  And, the experience is a mildly entertaining one.  There is a definite end to the game, if you can call it that.  The graphics are pretty, not horribly advanced mind you.  It is a computer hog and will use a decent amount of resources.  Overall, I would rate it Game/10.  I would say this 'game' is worth the $0.99 that's being charged, if nothing else, for the experience.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												My Mountain died multiple times w/o any interaction.So yeah after 40+ hours of letting this run and streaming it, I will try to give a better review of what this title is.It is a screensaver that is claiming to be art, while titled a game.The game itself is labled with features such as no controls. This is false, the game will trigger events that can lead to mountain death, and there are interactions that you can take with the Mountain, and the objects that it attracts.I am sorry but text input is a control and affects how you "play" this game.This is truly a mindless screensaver that is a scam. This is a sad attempt at art and should not be taken seriously.If you want a screensaver that will crash, and requires user input, then sure, this might be the right thing for you.  If you really expect anything more than that, avoid this title.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												Those games that are fun because they're odd and quirky? This isn't one of them. The hype surrounding Mountain is that it's an anti-game, or un-game. "You were expecting to DO something? That's not what this is! You don't get it!" Well, great. It's a virtual snowglobe with a cloak of gratuitous inscrutability and whimsy, riding on the coattails of the film 'Her'. You can get the gist of Mountain from a five-minute YouTube video.There are other developers on Steam who've put serious time and effort into making their one-buck games entertaining. Go support them instead.I do enjoy leaving it running in the background as a white-noise generator, as the weather effects and ambience are quite well done.

number of helpful: 9 of 18 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												This game is Bliss, Peace, and Tranquility.  Essentially $0.99 therapy...  Anyone who cannot see that this game isn't and will never be anything heart-racing or exciting should never have considered this game.  The game itself shocked me, for I've never experienced something of this sort.  Additionally, yes, I do consider this a game, not a ridiculous but interactive screensaver.I'm not going to get into philosophical things about how this game "mirrors the Soul", but I will say that I had an interesting time.  I WANTED to watch my mountain, I wanted to see it exist and  experience the simulation.  It isn't that it was exciting, but it was more so mezmerizing.  When the mountain had a thought, I was there and comprehending.  It's like watching a baby take it's first steps, beginning its journey through life.I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, unless you have ever felt alone or bored will sitting in your computer chair.  I get a feeling that I'm accompanied by...another entity while playing, or rather leaving it open in the background.  But there is definatly only a specific variety of people that could enjoy this simulation to the fullest extent.

content:
Posted: April 19
												Я не думаю, что многие люди не видят ценность в Горе, и когда люди делают, они стремятся просто усложнить игру так, как она есть. Это не значит, что это «игра». Разработчики игры целенаправленно говорят об этом изначально: «Оставьте это открытым - оно предназначено для работы на периферии вашей жизни. Только взаимодействуйте с ним, когда вам хочется. Вы можете играть в гору, играя в другие игры. Если вы не играете Он, он будет играть сам. ". Снова гора просто означает оставаться открытой, и вы можете вернуться к ней, когда захотите. Возможно, вы не сразу заметите его внешний вид, но вы можете найти его позже ... надеюсь. Но опять же, каковы стандарты «игры»? Должны ли мы просто отделять гору просто потому, что это возможно вне нормы? Напротив! Различный опыт приводит к различным точкам зрения, которые делают вас более открытыми. Так могут люди действительно заявить, что Гора - не игра, а скринсейвер? Существует множество способов просмотра горы и ее просмотра, поскольку скринсейвер - одна из наиболее популярных деморализованных точек зрения, к которым многие так привыкли. Поэтому можно рассматривать гору просто как автономную, а не сравнивать ее с более современными проблемами. Или можно сравнить, но тем самым теряешь номинал самой игры. Я думаю, что теперь я решил, что эта «игра» может быть скринсейвером или просто не «игрой» вообще.С другой стороны, разработчики заявили следующее: «Если у вас неприятный шторм или скучная ночь, сыграйте мелодию (используя клавиатуру), и время ускорится». Гора там для вас, когда вы решите вернуться к ней и сыграть ее. Я думаю, что это распространенное заблуждение. Это не столько игра для вас, сколько вспомогательная и поддерживающая игра рядом с вами. Тем не менее, есть много способов увидеть Горы, как с любой формой проблемы в жизни. Но Путь Гора был построен, порой непривлекательный для глаз, позволяет ему показать вам другой путь и, возможно, тот, который вы, возможно, не видели раньше.Но вам не нужно следить за тем, что говорят разработчики. «Игра» должна воспроизводиться в зависимости от того, как вам это нравится. Если вы чувствуете, что вас обманули, купив эту игру, тогда сделайте два шага назад и подумайте об аспектах этой «игры» и элементов. Возможно, вы начинаете замечать замечательный окружающий звук, который играет среди ночи, или, может быть, вы влюблены в то, как полосы солнца касаются вашей Горы. Но вам может не понравиться все это, чтобы по-настоящему насладиться игрой. Возможно, у вас есть все эти игры, и у вас появилась любовь к игре. Или, может быть, вы пытаетесь насмехаться над игрой, но в свою очередь вы уже привыкли к игре. Я, например, не могу ответить на этот вопрос о том, понравится ли геймеру это или нет, но все зависит от того, кто его покупает, и готов ли он открыть свое сердце и ум.Теперь Гора действительно ваша гора и ваша собственная собственность? Я думаю, что в концепции только геймера для геймера можно составить представление о том, действительно ли Гора является само воплощением, или игрок действительно управляет Горой. Гора не говорит с нами и не рассказывает нам о ее мыслях? Или это передача скрытого сообщения туда, где мы могли бы быть его собственным порождением, и это - мастер. Каким бы способом вы не сочли нужным, существует достаточно много способов увидеть гору, как в любой игре. В горах может не быть сюжетной линии, не стрельбы, не любовного треугольника (если только вы не начнете что-то делать между вещами, Горой и небом, и в этом случае вы, возможно, пошли слишком далеко), но в Горе есть Момент одиночества, в котором вы можете заметить вещи в играх, которые могут повторяться в горах. Возможно, Гора может содержать все эти элементы, в которых вы создаете историю. Гора всегда может быть сюжетной линией, в которой вы, геймер, идете по дорожке с Горой к месту назначения в ваше подсознание. В горах многое предстоит сделать, и ваше воображение будет блокировано, а логика только помешает этому. Но если вы так решите сделать это, вы не обидели никого, кроме себя, в отрицании возможных сил в самой игре. Этот обзор не может показать мой нейтралитет по отношению к игре, но я только хочу объяснить геймеру, что гора может быть акцентирована только игроком.
