content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												I want everyone to understand... this isnt a game.... this is life.You are not meant to "Play" it... there is no set story, there is no "amazing" over advertised gameplay. This is a new type of art.this is an Ambient game. you let it run while you do other things, if you get bored and have nothing to to, go play on the mountain. play some music, name all the flora.I have a bush named Tim.... did you know Tim cant talk?aaand Tim... jsut dissapeared? :C bye Tim, i wish you a safe journy wherever you may have gone!anyways. sometimes a thing will happen, and you will have that thing for a while, and then the thing will be gone. some things stay longer than others... you grow attached to your mountain like you might grow to love a small fuzzy anim-Tim just came back...? and... he's a bigger plant now? Good job Tim! i knew you could grow up into a big bush if you ate all your vitamins!But i digress, you ARE the mountain, and the mountain is you, you make friends with the all the nice things that grow on you! like Tim! Tim is by far my bestest friend yet! and i've only owned the game for an hour! soooo a Miniature planetoid just landed next to Tim... Im going to name it Karin... Hello Karen!This is my final Message to you all. This game is better than browsing tumblr for hours on end, its better than checking facebook. you can actually just open up your browser and do all those things, and you can go check on your mountain, and see ALL the new friends you've made. It might be the past midnight tiredness, or the fact this game is like being stranded on a lone island in the middle of a vast nothingness, where you feel so alone you have to name inanimate objects so they can me your friends, but its alot like life. Some things happen that you like, some things happen you dont. rarely does anything last permanently, but the things that do, make the best friends of all...-TyirelPS: I am not Crazy... i am MountainPSS: I AM MOUNTAIN.... I AM GODPSSS: I TASTE RED

number of helpful: 10 of 21 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Have you ever wondered how it feels like to stand still for millions of years? Me neither. This game is the most realistic simulator out there. All you do is stand still and wait for time to pass - just like a mountain! You can also, for some reason, play music with your keyboard. I can't imagine a better way to spend your time than playing happy version of Freezing Moon to your mountain. Unfortunately there's no grass in this game so I can't combine this realistic experience with my favorite hobby; watching the grass grow. Hopefully we'll get a grass DLC soon!This game also has a psychological test when you start to play. I in fact had to rely on a walkthrough to be able to pass this part of the game. I really like this feature - keeps adhd kids away from the game. The roleplay feel in this game is immersive! You can identify yourself as whatever mountain you want to be! Stone mountain? Sure! Grass mountain? Sure! Feminist-bipolar-misandric-racefluid-tumblr-mountain? Yup!I'd like to end this in-depth review by mentioning the insanely realistic weather system! Rain doesn't go through any roof! Mountain - 1, Skyrim - 0A rock solid 8/10 because it lacks grass.

content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												With Mountain, you can simulate the feelings that come from being a mountain. This game isn't a game. It's an experience that you'll always remember within yourself. You will experience the sensation of a solitary existence in a vast empty void accompanied only by assorted objects and the weather. The days will be bright and warm. The nights will be gloomy but beautiful. The rain will make you feel cold but will bring a sort of comfort. The cold, cold snow will freeze you but you will feel an inner warmth. You will begin to accept your new life as a mountain as you transcend your mere mortal existence. You will become something much, much more. You will become a mountain and a god. Buy Mountain today.

												Okay, lets get one thing straight, this is a game in which you, The Mountain, don't do anything. You're supposed to let nature take it course and eventually stuff will appear on your mountain. For all the people who want to play some sort of God-Like role where you can do anythingt, that's not the case. You can't control nature, nature is unpredictable.For all the negative reviews it gets for being a "Screensaver" is completely irrelevant. It's a game in which you leave open while you play another game, browse the internet, or even leave the game running while you go to bed and in the morning, you can see how much stuff your mountain has when you wake up.It's a fun, cheap game that I sure will put tons of hours into. And you should too.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												Pro-tip: typing 'as,zb' (minus the quotes) makes it more interesting.The game is essentially a simulator of life in a sense. It is about a mountain that is floating in space- yeah, you heard me, SPACE!- and has random things happen to it. It conveys its feelings sometimes and can be mildly interacted with by the player.It is basically a game that, as said on the store page, should be run in the background. It isn't something you're supposed to sit and stare at and wait for something to happen (I mean, you can if you want, I wouldn't recommend it).You can play piano notes on your keyboard by hitting the A-K and Z-,(comma) keys, supposing you use a QWERTY style keyboard. Hitting some combinations will unlock different modes such as blood rain, fish rain and constant snow (those are the three they give you on the store page). There might be more, I have no idea really. Hitting these keys can also change the speed of rotation of the mountain.Randomly, objects such as bowling pins, crates, hearts, steel girders, etc. will fly from space into the mountain. You can click and hold on these items to drag them around the mountain and move their placement. As stated above, your mountain apparently can die. It is dramatic and depressing, because mountain is love, mountain is life.Lastly, if you hit .(period), the mountain will say random things to you as if it is expressing its feelings. Along with this, it will randomly say things if just left alone for periods of time as well.Over all, if you're expecting a very interactive, hands-on game, then this isn't the game for you. This game is meant to sit there and essentially just be for random events / fun, as if it were a screensaver. I believe it was made for the user to ponder life and their own existence based on the feelings and events that occur to / with the mountain.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2014
												Looks nice and creates a meditative setting. However, there is not much you can do. You can watch your mountain (what you're doing most of the time) and play tunes on your keyboard. Occasionally your mountain will express a thought, which are mostly generic, like "it's cold outside" generic. (Well, it's a mountain after all...) Rarely some items appear. In ~2h running, all I got were some extra plants and a random crowbar(?).It's meant to be run in the background. There is a problem with that:When you run this game in window mode, it demands ~30% of my CPU (Core i7). The problem is: That costs money. For both, the power of the CPU and for fans required to cool it down. So "playing" this "game" is rather expensive, even if it costs only < 1€. Instead, if you play in fullscreen, you don't get event notifications. It's hard to tell if the game is running at all.I can't really recommend this game. Not much happens. Instead, it (indirectly) contributes to the pollution of the environment. 4.5/10Constructive criticism towards the developers:Please add some more things players can do instead of just watching. Preferably something the can change the development of your mountain. And please find a way to decrease CPU usage.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												Greatest screen saver of all time. I'm going to do as suggested and just leave it on in the background to suck up my CPU and memory so I can't play real games. I'm just kidding. You should totally get this. You see, it's this thing...and you draw some things, then there's a mountain..and you just leave it there. That's how mountain works. Remember screen savers? In the days when those old CRT monitors with Windows 3.11 would get super bad screen burn that would never go away? That's what this does, only with a quad core CPU and memory. And you draw pictures to tell it how to procedurally generate. I guess. Yeah. 10/10 best screen saver simulator EVER.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Honestly this game was fantastic. Act 2 was where it really got good. Once Benjamin relayed the message to the resistance, things got INSANE. One thing I didn't like was when he shot Anna but she had it coming, as we all know. If you haven't finished the game yet I would highly recommend it, there's a lot more to the story than you think. It tackles various meaningful messages such as love, loss, virtue, and the ever so important honor. Do yourself a favor and take a journey you never thought could exist on any platform of media. I know the beginning is slow, but please keep playing, you won't be let down. One thing I would have changed about the game would be how the control scheme is set up for switching weapons from the backpack. It took me forever to master it and once I did the game was about over. 10/10 I would recommend Mountain to anyone with a pulse.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2016
												This will be my first review. The moment I started this game, I suddenly had this strong urge to submit a review.I saw this in a bundle and was skeptical at first whether I will enjoy it or not. It was the former. It is true that I merely have a few minutes clocked but, it felt as if time have slowed as I watched my mountain and played with the keys (which was purely accidental)-- from A-K and Z-M--. Go ahead, try playing calming tones while watching your mountain face the seasons, grow reeds and vegetation, and among many others. As an aspiring programmer, this is an absolute lifesaver because of the stress that piles up whenever a deadline approaches.  This is not for everyone, that I say. I have a few says about the menu but only minimal. If you are seeking a game where your stress is calmed by beautiful music, sweet tones, and watching the nature take it slowly, then this is an absolute must for you.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												If this game cost more I would have an even longer review; it is not a game. If you want to say that "It's supposed to delve into philosophy and expand the definition of a game" thing, fine. good for you. but don't put it on steam. This is literally nothing more than a rotating entity with changing backgrounds. I don't want to be to hard on it (Because it's only a dollar), but it has no purpose other than to waste your time. I could hop onto Netbeans and code something like this in under an hour, and this really worries me about the gaming market. With all the press that this game is getting, and amount of copies sold of this tiny game, some people will start making games like this simply to make a quick buck and write them off as games that "delve into philosophy and expand the definition of a game" to cover their greed. I don't understand why so many people give this a positive review, as it doesn't deserve it and only encourages people to make clones of it.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												At first I was alone.But I was happy.Everytime I looked at myself I smiled.Then some thing appeared inside of me. It was a pickaxe.At first I was scared, petrified of what misfortunes the pickaxe would bring.Then I realized, Pickaxe is not my enemy. It's my friend.Pickaxe soon became my best friend - I picked it up, threw it around, Pickaxe didn't care.I was so happy, more than ever before.But one time, after I let go of the Pickaxe, it didn't slam back into me like it did before.The pickaxe left. Pickaxe flew away.My heart is broken. I shed a tear.Days have passed and I've been so alone, but a glimmer of light appeared out of nowhere.It was a red umbrella, so beautifully lush and shiny.It became my new best friend.I am happy, once again.This game is an emotional rollercoaster.42/10

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												This is an interesting concept.  You play as a "God," over this piece of land.  You can't really do too much with it though.  Its a nice little idea I suppose.  You get to play some melodys though which speed up o slow down the time on the mountain.  It will continue to progress even if you aren't playing with it.  I bought it because I had a dollar left on my steam wallet soooo...yeah..I think it is semi entertaining.  I don't understand the complaints and downvotes being given for this game due to "its not a game," or "its a screensaver."  It literally tells you in its description whats going to happen when you play it and what to look for.     Its a nice, peaceful thing that can be a positive experience.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I never like to say bad things about other people's work as i am sure who ever put this together must have spent some time and effort on it. But honestly save that 99p and put it towards buying a leadless pencil or a decaff latte or an inflatable darts board or alcohol free beer or an extra long bungee cord or see-through curtains or a sponge knife or chicken McNuggets or really, absolutely anything else whatsoever. Its really not a lot of money but I do feel mildly offended that i no longer have it. As a matter of fact I would feel happier if I had simply just lost a £1 coin down the back of my sofa, at least that way I would have the joy of maybe one day finding it again.I am tempted to email steam and offer them another 99p to permanently remove this "game" from my account.If you feel the need to play this, go to youtube and watch any gameplay video of it, its free that way. I have never reviewed a game before and I believe I have taken more enjoyment in writing this than I did witnessing this waste of computer code. DO NOT BUY. 												What can i say? You literally Watch a Mountain Spin, experience the 4 seasons and you can play your own music feat. God, on the most beautiful of all stages. Space. While you listen to the piano chords linger through space you sit and think about life. Watching this mountain spin. you think about all the important things, you rethink many important issues. This Game is literally refreshing even though you dont really "play" a game you still experience something new. its only 99 cents Buy this game watch the magic happen and feel refreshed.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												I love the concept. It's a neat little application to have idling while you're doing other things. However, it's far too resource intensive for something that is meant to be running in the background. If left alone, with no other games or applications running, Mountain causes my GPU to heat to an upwards of 50 degrees celsius. That is absurd. This is a sign of shoddy programming. Please clean up your work, I'm very surprised this wasn't addressed before release. Did the developer never run the game themselves?
